intro: Cleanthes hieracioides, commonly known as the Sierra lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, inconspicuous fruits that contain the seeds. This species is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitats.
